agency_desc: A nonprofit, faith-based organization providing an addiction recovery program in transitional housing for men.
service_description: Provides alcohol and drug use recovery program in a transitional housing facility for men. Program is faith-based and lasts one year.
taxonomy_name: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel3: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Visit website to download application. Once complete, mail application to site address.
site_eligibility: Men -- Age 18 or older -- Wanting to end drug or alcohol addiction -- Able to self-pay for program

agency_desc: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Marshall County.
service_description: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Marshall County, including performing the following duties: Controls, maintains, and supervises county property -- Audits and authorizes claims against the county -- Receives bids for and authorizes county contracts -- Performs certain election functions -- Handles appeals of township trustee decisions
site_details: Call for assistance.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: Monthly 1st Mon 8:30am and 3rd Mon at 9:45am
site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY OF MARSHALL COUNTY
agency_desc: A nonprofit Christian housing ministry that builds and renovates affordable housing for qualified individuals and families in Marshall County.
site_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY OF MARSHALL COUNTY
service_description: Builds homes for eligible persons with low-income in Marshall County. Participants contribute a set number of hours of labor ("sweat equity") toward the construction of a dwelling that they may then purchase through an affordable loan. Volunteer opportunities are also available for interested individuals and service groups.
site_details: Walk in or call to request an application or print one off the website.
site_eligibility: Living in Marshall County -- Household income between 25%-60% of median (Call or see website for current amounts) -- Stable employment or other source of income for at least one year -- Currently have reasonably good credit

service_description: Provides nonperishable and perishable food to those in need. Assistance with transportation to and from the pantry may be provided.
site_details: Walk in for service. -- For Transportation: Call Marshall County Council on Aging to arrange transportation.
site_eligibility: Living in Marshall County -- Low income -- Limit one visit every two weeks

agency_name: BREAD OF LIFE COMMUNITY FOOD PANTRY
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization serving as a community-based food pantry to those in need.
site_name: BREAD OF LIFE COMMUNITY FOOD PANTRY
service_description: Provides supplemental food to qualified seniors in need. Food items may include fresh produce, dairy, and frozen meats. Special diets may be accommodated.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Age 60 or older -- Income that is at or less than 130% of the federal poverty guidelines

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Call to schedule a screening appointment. If voicemail is reached, leave name and number for a return call.
site_eligibility: Veteran, surviving spouses or children of a veteran.

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: A council consisting of local churches that provide charitable outreach, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides nonperishable food to those in need. Milk and eggs may be available depending on donations. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in and proceed downstairs.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A church offering worship services and charitable outreach programs, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food, including frozen meats and personal hygiene items to people in need. Clients make their own selection from available items. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Not received assistance from this pantry in the past 14 days; Living in the Argos area.

agency_desc: A church offering worship services and charitable outreach programs, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food, including frozen meats and personal hygiene items to people in need. Clients make their own selection from available items. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Not received assistance from this pantry in the past 14 days; Living in the Argos area.

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a local food pantry and the Commodity Supplemental Food Pantry.
service_description: Provides nonperishable food and frozen meats to those in need. Pantry also has cleaning supplies on second Wednesdays and hygiene products on fourth Wednesdays. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Living in Marshall County

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a local food pantry and the Commodity Supplemental Food Pantry.
service_description: Provides nonperishable food and frozen meats to those in need. Pantry also has cleaning supplies on second Wednesdays and hygiene products on fourth Wednesdays. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Living in Marshall County

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a local food pantry and the Commodity Supplemental Food Pantry.
service_description: Provides nonperishable food and frozen meats to those in need. Pantry also has cleaning supplies on second Wednesdays and hygiene products on fourth Wednesdays. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Living in Marshall County

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that partners with local human service organizations, businesses, and government agencies to support and strengthen the community.
service_description: Provides support to partner agencies and programs to address human service needs. Seeks funding through corporate giving programs and individual donations. All assistance is provided through partnering agencies; no direct services are provided through this agency.
site_details: Call or visit website for information or to make a contribution.
site_eligibility: Nonprofit human service agencies

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency offering a variety of services for seniors, including transportation, home-delivered meals, and recreational activities.
service_description: Offers free, objective information on Medicare, Medicare supplements, Medicare Advantage plans, Medicaid, long-term care insurance, and prescription assistance programs. SHIP counselors are trained and certified by the Indiana Department of Insurance.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: People who are or will soon become eligible for Medicare

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency offering a variety of services for seniors, including transportation, home-delivered meals, and recreational activities.
service_description: Offers activities for older adults, including special interest classes, social activities, travel, and field trips. Classes are offered weekly with ongoing seminars. "People's University" offers  fall and spring class sessions at a variety of locations.
site_details: Call, walk in, or visit website for information.
site_eligibility: Age 60 or older -- Classes: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency offering a variety of services for seniors, including transportation, home-delivered meals, and recreational activities.
service_description: Provides daily meals to homebound seniors and persons with disabilities in Marshall County. Hot meals are delivered in most areas with frozen meal service available for the entire county.
site_details: Call for an eligibility assessment.
site_eligibility: Home-bound due to age or a disability

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency offering a variety of services for seniors, including transportation, home-delivered meals, and recreational activities.
service_description: Provides information, referral, and counseling options for seniors in the local area. Trained staff answer questions about issues such as nutrition, housing, transportation, medical equipment, health care, support services, and government benefit programs.
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency offering a variety of services for seniors, including transportation, home-delivered meals, and recreational activities.
service_description: Provides information, referral, and counseling options for seniors in the local area. Trained staff answer questions about issues such as nutrition, housing, transportation, medical equipment, health care, support services, and government benefit programs.
site_details: Call for information.

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Coordinates lead poisoning case management for youth living within the County.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Living within the county -- Testing is recommended for any child 6 months through 6 years old who: Lives in or visits a building constructed before 1978 -Or- lives with someone who works with lead (such as a battery factory, steel smelter, stained glass) -OR- has a sibling or playmate who has been diagnosed with lead poisoning.

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides low-cost or free immunizations for County youth (through age 18) who are uninsured, whose insurance does not cover the required vaccination, or who are enrolled in Medicaid. Also provides immunizations for American Indians and Alaskan Natives under age 18 regardless of their insurance status.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or for availability of walk-in hours.
site_eligibility: Living within the Marshall County or a surrounding county-- Age 2 months through 18 years-old -- Without health insurance -OR- insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides inspections, permits, code enforcement, and other services to protect the health and safety of Marshall County residents. Regulates drainage and septic systems. Reports are accepted for public swimming pools, tattoo parlors, and food service establishments in the county. Investigates reports of sanitation violations, substandard housing conditions, air or water pollution, and safety hazards posed by vacant buildings. Offers information and referrals regarding household health and environmental hazards such as mold, lead, radon, tap water contamination, mosquitoes, and rodents.
site_details: Call for information, to request services, or to make a report.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; serves Marshall County

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services for the state of Indiana.
service_description: Conducts state law enforcement and criminal investigations and enforces traffic laws on state highways and interstate expressways. This agency also provides technical and other special assistance to local and federal law enforcement agencies and conducts research and planning regarding law enforcement services in Indiana. This district office serves Bartholomew, Dearborn, Decatur, Franklin, Jackson, Jefferson, Jennings, Ohio, Ripley, and Switzerland County.
site_details: Call or visit the website for information or nonemergency assistance. For emergency police assistance, call 9-1-1.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; this district office serves Elkhart, Kosciusko, Marshall, and St Joseph County.

agency_desc: Our mission is to strengthen our communities and to improve the health and well-being of those we are privileged to serve. We use evidence based practices that treat the whole person. Our team of board-certified psychiatrists and psychologists, highly trained and certified therapists, nurses, and case workers deliver comprehensive care and treatment for mental health conditions.
service_description: Offers outpatient treatment for adults and youth experiencing a mental health issue or psychiatric disorder, such as anger management, anxiety, attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), bi-polar disorder, depression, post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), or schizophrenia. Services include an initial assessment as well as individual, group, and/or family counseling. Case management, psychiatric medication services, home-based services, community-based psychiatric rehabilitation, supported employment services, and residential programs are available to eligible patients receiving treatment from this center.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_schedule: Mon and Thurs 8am-6pm; Tues 8am-7pm; Wed and Fri 8am-5pm
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides low-cost, nutritious meals and limited food vouchers for area seniors.
service_description: Offers Farmers Market vouchers to eligible seniors at no cost to use at participating farmers markets for fresh fruits and vegetables. Each participant receives $20 in vouchers, while supplies last.
site_details: Call or walk in for information, or to apply.
site_eligibility:
Living in Elkhart, Kosciusko, Marshall, Fulton, or St Joseph County
Age 60 or older
Household income at or below 185% federal poverty guidelines

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides low-cost, nutritious meals and limited food vouchers for area seniors.
service_description: Provides a hot lunch each weekday to seniors age 60 or older. Reservations must be made by 11am the previous business day. A small donation is requested but not required.
site_details: Call to make a reservation by 11am the day before the meal.
site_eligibility: Age 60 or older (and accompanying spouse of any age)

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that provides a variety of social services, including employment related services and educational services.
service_description: Provides a resource center for job seekers with computer access, online job boards, assistance setting up an email account, online tutorials and workshops, and access to a fax machine and copier. Services include resume building, computer instruction, mock interviews, hiring events, and connecting to individuals community resources and job leads.

agency_desc: A crisis pregnancy organization that provides support and resources to help women in need carry their pregnancies to term.
service_description: Provides parenting and childbirth education programs for parents and expectant parents. Participants earn coupons that can be redeemed at Crib Club for baby and maternity items. Classes are available in-person as well as online zoom classes.
site_details: Call to schedule an intake appointment or to find out about upcoming classes.
site_eligibility: Pregnant women and parents of children age 5 or younger

agency_desc: A crisis pregnancy organization that provides support and resources to help women in need carry their pregnancies to term.
service_description: Provides parenting and childbirth education programs for parents and expectant parents. Participants earn coupons that can be redeemed at Crib Club for baby and maternity items. Classes are available in-person as well as online zoom classes.
site_details: Call to schedule an intake appointment or to find out about upcoming classes.
site_eligibility: Pregnant women and parents of children age 5 or younger

agency_desc: A crisis pregnancy organization that provides support and resources to help women in need carry their pregnancies to term.
service_description: Provides a one-time assistance for baby formula during emergencies for families with infants. Recurring assistance is available for those participating in other services at this location.
site_details: Call to schedule a pick-up for baby formula during emergencies.
site_eligibility: With an infant in the household on supplemental feeding -- In emergency or first time seeking assistance from this agency for baby formula

agency_desc: A crisis pregnancy organization that provides support and resources to help women in need carry their pregnancies to term.
service_description: Offers ultrasounds to individuals who are pregnant, determines viability and age of pregnancy.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: First trimester of pregnancy

agency_desc: A crisis pregnancy organization that provides support and resources to help women in need carry their pregnancies to term.
service_description: Provides diapers, baby clothing (up to size 5T), and maternity clothing for new and expectant mothers in need. Items are available to clients who attend parenting classes in order to earn coupons for use at Crib Club where they can be redeemed for baby items. Maternity clothing is available without participating in the classes.
site_details: Call to schedule an intake appointment.
site_eligibility: Pregnant women and mothers or fathers of children age 5 or younger

agency_desc: A crisis pregnancy organization that provides support and resources to help women in need carry their pregnancies to term.
service_description: Provides free, walk-in pregnancy testing, pregnancy verification required for medical benefits, and referrals to prenatal care, adoption agencies, and other abortion alternatives for women facing a crisis pregnancy. No referrals are made to abortion service providers.
site_details: Walk-ins accepted; calling ahead is recommended.
site_eligibility: Women
